intro: Eschweilera roseocalyx, commonly known as the pink-flowered evergreen, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and broad, elliptical leaves. The plant produces striking pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
